data.message: Hi Mary - not sure which is the worst offender but I have sample many many tonics (uk) !! The best I have found - that I can personally tolerate is Franklin & Sons. Not carried by any supermarkets except Fortnum & Mason 🙄 but you can get on Amazon. I can do a little fever tree but not much & this brand seems better. Proceed with caution I am not Ana - but very sensitive under 10 ppm.
Also has discovered Eager a fresh juice brand carried byOcado if u don’t want to squeeze your own. I have tried orange & grapefruit
I'd be interested to know as I always feel quite ill after taking fevertree tonic.
So.. there's Quinine Sulphate and Quinine Hydrochloride... My tonics say Quinine Hydrochloride... Anyone know the difference..?! 🤨

I am sulphite intolerant and also cannot have many of the artificial sweeteners.  Luckily I can drink Schweppes Indian Tonic (with sugar & saccharin which is okay for me). So it's G&T to the rescue when friends are having wine with the meal 😀😁

message:
I've just found out that Quinine in tonic water is actually Quinine Sulfate. I never knew..! 🙄
I always thought it was the citric acid in tonic water that I should be weary of. 
Is Quinine a more likely offender to react to than citric acid..? 
Thanks x

data.message:
Practically all Natural Mineral Waters and Sparkling Mineral Waters. 
If you react to natural sulphates then you need to look for those which have lower levels. Natural sulphates are necessary for a healthy gut and brain - and those are needed to heal the gut for instance.
So, like, Perrier? Etc.? (I do not react to sulphates/sulfates.)

Liz Costales Perrier the plain one is okay. Flavoured contain many non labeled ingredients. 
Fiji is one good one. Many other European ones as well.
Next time when you go to the Supermarket you can take some pictures and post here.
Thank you!

Tiiu, thanks for this information! I agree with calling companies and verifying. 

What brands of mineral water are considered safe for us? I was thinking about trying some.
Yes! I called my city and found out they are added to our water. Yuck.
Yes, in some places the filters which run through the city water have sulfites.
It would also explain why a lot of city water contains sulfites and sulfites after being treated. I find one water and stick to it. My home water is horrible.
No wonder I hate the taste of this water!!! Thanks for the info.
I’ve been using a portable zero filter bottle when I travel. Filling from drinking fountains and faucets. I can’t believe how fast the filter got used up!!

yeah, I've had reactions to bottled water and I remember specifically Dasani, made by Coca Cola, a problem. I have my own reverse osmosis filter at home and take my own water with me places. Thank you for posting Tiiu Ounila

I remember them trying to launch that in the UK. Was a complete disaster when the press ridiculed them for selling bottle tap water and then a batch got contaminated with carcinogenic chemicals. They withdraw the brand in the UK! http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/business/3809539.stm
Amen. Thank you!
And can tolerate smart water
I had symptoms resembling heart attack from bottled water which i then found contain sulfites. I tolerate Deer Park.
Thank you for the info.I’ve been having issues after drinking Dasani water but wasn’t sure if it was the culprit or not. Now I know.
Doesn’t some natural mineral water have sulphuric content, naturally? Or just not that much...
Oh my.  More work I need to do.  Knowing that you react to sulfites is nothing short of life changing.
Mine was one of the things making me sick. I bought a ZeroWater pitcher and can now use tap water again.
I'll check that out.  Had no idea that tap water had sulfites!
Linnea Fraser Wieland Not all cities. I called my city, and found out they do use it. Worth a call.
Will do.  My reaction to sulfite ingestion is pretty immediate...heart racing.  If our tap water had sulfites, I'd imagine I'd be experiencing heart racing all day long and I do not.
I drink a ton of tap water every day.  That may be making me sick! OMG

Thanks for reminding us again.  You’re the Best! Hope you are better and having fun 
💕

message:
DASANI water is bottled tap-water which is filtered through sulfite containing filters and lab made sulphates are added to it to make it taste better. 
So anyone in this group, take note to avoid this water. There are other bottled tap waters as well, which might not or might have gone through a filtration with sulfite filters, so unless you have verified with the company skip those and choose either Natural Mineral Waters or Sparkling Mineral waters which are bottled in the source. 
Some distilled waters are safe, again some are not, so you need to do a lot of research by yourself as well. There are so many bottled water companies around the world, that it is impossible to write them all and ask what filters they use. 
For your health it is better to stick to Natural Mineral Waters - why would you pay a high price of bottled tap water with added sulphates ?

data.message: All my cleaning products are mostly Melaleuca and H2O@home.  I called some friends who own Forest Grove Coffee Company. Robert called his vendor who in turn called their green bean wholesaler.  None used in their non flavored coffees.  The grower end has not yet responded.  I've got bread going in my bread machine now.  My pharmacist recommended I check the NIH med database as I know more about sulfite ingredients than he does.  I'm going to go pick up my oral ketotifen at Beaverton Pharmacy today.  It seems to really help with my face flushing, then my throat, chest, arms, the hives, the angioedema.  I'm going to endeavor to learn how not to poison myself but first more ketotifen.

Angelina Salwak I buy my organic chicken same as you boneless skinless thighs and chicken breast and ground beef from Costco.  I got the organic drumsticks, they are on a pad but I take off the skin and wash well, I have been good with it, just wanted you to know in case you are missing chicken with bone.
For coffee I get organic Colombian from Luckys Market. 👌
Yasmin Ladha thank you!

I live in Portland too! Costco, New Seasons and Fred Meyer are where I shop. 

Some brands that offer a lot of safe options are Kirkland and Simple Truth Organic. I get Kirkland organic chicken breast/thighs and their organic ground beef. Shrimp and other shellfish have high naturally occurring sulfites and I've learned "no preservatives" unfortunately seems to be meaningless. I get my coffee from Fred Meyer. They sell bulk whole bean organic coffee.

I haven't tried Open Nature brand. Most of the meats I've seen had the little white pads underneath which are sulfited. I've been generally unimpressed with Safeway.

I make my own cleaning products. I gave up on finding store bought ones haha. I use vinegar (some may react), hydrogen peroxide and tea tree oil.
Btw, I've found a few safe restaurants here! Harlow, Dick's Kitchen and the margherita pizza at Life of Pi

Sorry, I keep remembering things. Tillamook and Bob's Red Mill are huge brands out here. Unfortunately Bob's uses sulfites to clean their equipment so they definitely have those hidden sulfites. Tillamook seems to use a lot of artificial ingredients in their products which is super sad because their ice cream looks delicious.

If you ever want to get together and have a shopping adventure, I'd be down!
Karen Debenedictis I own some. I'm pretty afraid of eating. I've been reacting almost daily for over a year. Buying all new supplies is costly.
I do just fine with Kirkland organic canned tomatoes/tomato paste/sauce. Safeway’s Open Nature brand does not work for me however.
Liz Costales the conversations were years old. I was looking for current info.
You can do a search on coffee, tomato sauces, etc. by using the search bar. The group has discussed these foods and there is information in the discussions.

message:
I'm new to this diagnosis. It's a relief to have the answer to my misery. In an attempt to stop poisoning myself I'm about to go shopping. I've read Rick Williams book, this group files(most), all the indicated websites, plus my own massive Google searches. I live in the Portland, Oregon area USA.  I'm good at research. Reasonably well informed this far. I'm healing from breast cancer treatment and chronic EBV. I used to have severe CFS/ME and POTS. I have EDS and  chronic migraine.  On that note Emgality monthly migraine injectable is life changing.  The snow is about to start AND I'm having abdominal surgery on Tuesday. 
Specific questions before I start calling manufacturers:
1.  What is your experience or opinion regarding Kirkland signature OTC medications? Specifically the 2 ibuprofen options and adult cetirizine/ generic Zyrtec?
2.  What is your best recommendation for coffee not processed with sulfite nor grown using added sulfites?
3.  What is your experience or opinion regarding sneaky sulfite?  Specifically in household cleaning products and kitchen stuff. I'm aware that bleached coffee filters are awful. What else?  Is dishwasher rinse aid a problem? 
4.  I'm obviously allergic to one or more oral medication and supplements. I know I can't tolerate Teva, Mylan, Pliva and most Breckenridge branded generic medications.  Opinions or experiences?
5.  Desperate to determine safe brand of tomato products. Muir Glen looks okay on no added sulfite. Opinions or recommendations?  Kirkland signature too?
6.  Opinion or experiences with Kirkland signature frozen shrimp. Package states no preservatives. 
7.  Opinion or experience with Safeway/Albertsons Open Nature brand?

data.message:
Anything you buy *could* have sulphites.

If you’re not super sensitive, you can likely get away with just reading the label on your packaged food. Watch for the naturally occurring sulphites (including eggs & soy) and places sulphites often hide (like corn starch, spices & citric acid).

But otherwise it’s a good idea to call the company. Every company. Ask them about whether they add sulphites, OR if they use them in processing.

For me, I’m sensitive enough that I make them ask their suppliers too, so it takes a while for them to get back to me. But, it’s worthwhile to call: that way you know for sure, and you’ll help educate companies that there are clients who want their products sulphite free 🙂
That mayo
Paprika that isnt organic is likely preserved.
I did eat more of the egg salad(no bread)and my heart did start beating fast and I suddenly felt tired so guess I'd better not eat that again!
if you’re having issues with egg... most mayo has eggs too
Maybe it was a matter of too many eggs then.  (I love eggs)
Buy mayo with no concentrated lemon juice in it
I bought a bread maker and make my own bread;  It's so easy, takes only 10 to gather all the ingredients, assemble and turn it on.   Delicious too.
Gail M Cramer could you post your bread recipe
Gail M Cramer I would like the recipe as well please.
Gail M Cramer That sounds good!
Most bread has corn syrup. I buy mine at a local bakery with limited ingredients.
Jill Watson Kent what was the brand?

our breads are preservative free....but contain vinegar-which does have sulphites. Yeast also has sulphites in it. The flour also will have an anti-clumping agent in, which has sulphites. I’m guessing the paprika will have anti clumping agents too.

Sherry Sykes Jacobs It was called Outback Bread.  I didn't make note of anything more as I thought I would just go back and get another loaf later....no one knew what I was talking about the first time, second time I went in girl in bakery said they weren't bringing it anymore...we tryed making our own but the yeast is a problem so next going to try Pita Bread.
Jill Watson Kent thanks for sharing!
I only buy bread that says No Sulphites right on the label.  So far I have only found 1 type and now they don't bring it in anymore...

Store-bought bread is pretty horrible. If you can, find bread from a local bakery where you can ask directly what ingredients they use. Also, most flour is bleached and through this process becomes sulfited. Mayonnaise could contain sulfites as well. The only one I've come across that doesn't is Chosen Foods avocado oil mayo. 

Essentially, sulfites have to do with how a food is processed. So one brand of a food item might be safe while another is not. The biggest dangers are emulsifying or bonding ingredients like lecithin/cellulose/maltodextrin/food staches, preservatives like citric acid/tocopherols/guar or xanthan gums/citric acid. Oils are also rough. Corn, vegetable, or canola oils are all sulfited. Any sugar supplement or sweetener will contain sulfites too like corn syrup, glucose, stevia, sucralose, or aspartame.

The easiest way to begin this lifestyle is when you're shopping at the grocery, never go to the center aisles. Everything you can eat will be on the edges like produce, meats, etc. Cook everything from scratch. Pre-packaged foods that are safe are incredibly difficult to find.
Excellent post!
Low fat mayo is evil!  It contains more contaminated ingredients.  Regular Best Foods/Hellman's seems like my best one so far.

message: An egg salad sandwich...aside from the eggs, which I know have naturally occurring sulfites, what else might contain sulfites...the bread? mayo? paprika?

data.message: I had issues with a varnish. I got a face mask and it helped enough for me to finish my project. I have also had issues with spray paint. Not sure it is a sulfite thing or just a general airway irritant
I did. I think all the dust and fumes was a huge problem for me
Thank you, that explains that then.
Yes
I get headaches whenever I work with paint. I react to formaldehyde, sulfites, and possibly other preservatives.
YES

message: Has anybody suffered throat tightening after painting and decorating?

data.message: I get headaches from the mint in toothpaste, it is caused by the salicylates in mint. If aspirin bothers you, you may also be sensitive to salicylates.

Yes I am sesitive to salicylates. But I wonder, it seems that tootpaste with fluoride is helping me. I don't know why. I used two toothpastes without mint.  https://www.iherb.com/pr/Jason-Natural-Kids-Only-Toothpaste-Orange-4-2-oz-119-g/18179

Second one https://www.iherb.com/pr/Zion-Health-ClayBrite-Sensitive-Natural-Toothpaste-4-oz-120-g/73030
I had headaches from both of them.
Both of these look high in salicylates.
I can't order that one, sorry, I live in Serbia, Europe, import taxes are too high.
Thank you, anyway.
This is what I use: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B018IOVBJS/ref=oh_aui_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&th=1

What about this one ? 
https://www.iherb.com/pr/Redmond-Trading-Company-Earthpaste-Amazingly-Natural-Toothpaste-Lemon-Twist-4-oz-113-g/52589#details
The lemon oils will be high in salicylate
"aloe barbadensis leaf juice" and " sodium methyl cocoyl taurate,aloe vera, green tea extract" = high salicylates/phenols

I use ultra brite  and sometimes add baking soda and or peroxide, but Crest destroys my gums and causes immense mouth pain. 
Strange that fluoride seems to help. Its like cement. Perhaps its protecting your gums.
Only one I've found is by Jason. It doesn't inflame my mouth or have carageenan
Ђурађ Дарчевић JASON Healthy Mouth Anti-Cavity & Tartar Control Gel, 6 Ounce Tube https://www.amazon.com/dp/B001T8MTWO/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_apa_i_zLTwCbDZ0Z0W4
I have the following problem - fluoride should be bad, but I have been using fluoride toothpaste without issues. This is fluoride toothpaste, too. I can't figure out... fluoride is good for us ?
Which one ?
It's from specific toothpastes. Jimmy Six helped me a lot.
If you are getting headaches from brushing I'd wonder if it is  tooth sensitivity, maybe something that irritates you triggering nerve pain
Sensodyne pronamel works for me xxx

Fluoride is traditionally helpful to gum issues.  The dentists I used to work with usually prescribed a fluoride gel for patients with gum disease. Gel Kam.   I have been using just baking soda and coconut oil.  I have been able to buy gel kam from the pharmacy without prescription but haven't tried it yet.
I reacted to Prevident when my dentist prescribed it instead.
You can just use the toothbrush and safe water, the mechanical action of the toothbrush is actually what cleans your teeth. One dentist always said "you could use dog poo on a toothbrush and get your teeth clean"

message: Dear sufferers, anyone tried toothpaste WITH fluoride ? I tried toothpastes without fluoride, and I am getting headaches from them.

data.message:
Hi, 
I don’t have a good multi but for my daughter (7) she has improved greatly since a naturopath advised probiotics.

Multi vitamins aren't so great, honestly. They contain vitamins in forms that aren't easily digested or processed. Supplements should be based on personal genetics and needs so there isn't a "one size fits all" vitamin.
Adding in: I'm not sure if they have childrens vitamins, but most NOW and Solgar brand vitamins are bioavailable (able to be processed by the body) and sulfite free!
I give my son the thorne children's vitamin

message: Hi all, I asked this once already but didn’t really get much response, so trying again!: does anyone have a recommendation for a good toddler multivitamin that is sulfite free?  Everything I find has citric acid in it.

data.message: Perfect. Thank you.
Thank you for that link:) lots of useful information

message: SEARCH before you ask.

ANNOUNCEMENT: We are seeing a sharp increase in posts by members who are asking repeat questions and who have not searched the group first. If it is a topic that is easily searchable and that has been discussed/answered before, we will not approve the post. 

Please do a search of the group before posting.

Repeat questions/posts clutter the feed and make work for those of us who volunteer to admin this group. In addition, your questions may be answered by previous posts much quicker than posting for responses.

Thank you.

data.message: Omgosh riiiight! I have a pile of stuff that is just not going to work out.
Following! I've been on a never ending search for conditioner.
MethoSULFATE wouldn't that be a flag?
Not sure 🤔?
Let me know how this works out for you over time! I swear I'm so tired of having dry hair.
Angelina Salwak  I will! I think it'll be ok because I can tell pretty fast lately. I am just not exactly sure what I am reacting to.

This is my latest try.  I'm not sure if it is safe for everyone,  I have used it a couple days and haven't had any issue yet.  I can't do most scents.  It seems I can't tolerate sulfates or SLS at this time.  Allergic to aloe.  I have very limited knowledge of the sulfates still.
Trisha Given  i used to work in food industry and we couldn’t clean with quats for our organic lines. Just a tidbit if info 🙂
Aleen Nader I learn something every day here.  One of these days I'll get it figured out. Thank you!
Trisha Given ditto! Lol

Aleen Nader there's soooo much! I thought allium, aloe and lily family allergy was bad. I am still kind of hyperactive and I know now of several things that I have reacted to most of my life and thought were random are due to sulfates or SLS, but I need testing to figure out it I think.  It's so overwhelming but explains a lot. Glad to be here to learn.
Trisha Given

Angelina Salwak I bought one similar at a health food store,  I liked it but not the scent.  
I found the Shea Moisture coconut and hibiscus rhassoul clay shampoo bar to be terrific.  The fragrance is verrrry low, it has a nice suds,  it's moisturizing,  even to my hands as I wash.  Again I am not sure if the ingredients are safe for everyone but I have been able to use it for a few weeks now.
Angelina Salwak  i don’t think it would be safe for me. Always on the lookout for new products tho 🙂
I did finally find a shampoo that's ok!

message:
Thoughts? Safe to use? 
Thank you

data.message:
Yep. I haven't eaten out in almost four years. It is the only way to be sure I'm not poisoned by sulfites. I eat before I go out or go to someone's house or a party. I take my own foods on vacation and book a hotel room with a kitchen.

Sulfite sensitivity (if severe, which mine is) requires a total adjustment of eating habits, unfortunately.

I have an allergist but there doesn't seem to be a test for sulfite allergy.  They just hand a list of things that normally contain sulfites.  And what about the naturally occurring sulfites?  Are those a factor?
We found out because I was in the ER several times a month. Eliminating sulfates is all that helped.
Are sulfites and sulfates the same.

Linnea Fraser Wield they are not.  It took a while to get a good explanation of this, but basically they are different chemicals. SULFITES are the ones banned by FDA for use on salad bars, and the ones in wine.
How do you know your allergy to sulfites is severe?
I will.  This is a much bigger deal than I thought it was.

Linnea Fraser Wieland Yes, it really is, unfortunately. Sometimes I long for my former life, but I do try not to dwell on it. I have anaphylactic type attacks, so I have to be careful about nearly every little thing. Not just foods but skincare products, shampoos, fragrances, makeup, etc.
Oh geez.  Hadn't even thought about the non-food stuff.  I know there is gluten in a lot of those things.
Years ago, I went to my allergist complaining that my lips were itching.  He tested my lipstick.  Sure enough, it was gluten!
Linnea Fraser Wieland, check the files tab here and do lots of reading. Also search for topics--there is much to learn from everyone who has this sensitivity.
That's a good idea.  My daughter and I went to a movie the other night and there were no refreshments I could eat because of one reason or another.  Will need to bring something next time.
Yes. I do not eat out with friends or family. I still go, but I eat before hand.
Which restaurants???
I found it hard to explain to neighbors and friends why I can't eat these things without making THEM feel less than for eating them.  It's like I'm a food snob now.

Linnea Fraser Wieland no chains that I've discovered. Only local mom and pops. The west coast US has a few more options. Where I'm from in the Midwest there was nothing.

I completely understand about feeling like a food snob. It gets a little easier over time because you find people who either understand or take your word for it. The hardest thing I've dealt with is friends who don't seem to believe me.
Why would they not believe you?
Linnea Fraser Wieland I have no idea. Likely because they don't understand and my reactions are "invisible." I may have appeared healthy before my diet change so they think there was nothing wrong.
Yes, honestly it sucks. Friends don't always understand, but I don't eat out anymore. I've found a few select restaurants that are ok but it's taken years.
I bring my own wherever I go. 😊💕 but I am so much better that I have adjusted my lifestyle to fit my needs.
I've just stopped ordering anything with a sauce on it because there are sulfites in so many sauce ingredients.  Mayo, vinegar in any form, mustard, concentrated lemon juice are just the most common.

Linnea Fraser Wieland some condiments are ok, but so few. If you're ok with vinegar/mustard then you might be ok with naturally occurring sulfites. Many mayos have binders/emulsifiers and preservatives like soybean oil, canola oil, soy lecithin, maltodextrin and citric acid.
I found a safe mayo at Costco. Their avocado mayo is sulfite free aside from those naturally occurring in vinegar.
I can do some of those...vinegar, mustard for sure.  Possibly mayo.
Even if it’s supposed to be illegal to treat salad bar ingredients, who knows what happens before they get to the restaurant?
I don’t trust anything that could be chemically treated at restaurants... esp wary of Vegs that are probably processed .

Alliums on salad or cc? I eat salads (not premade and not cc with my allergies). I also can’t do salad dressing. If I’m out, I do pure olive oil only. At home, I make my own. My lo and I have multiple ana allergies and there aren’t safe dressings for us, unless we make them.
Other things in salad that I can’t eat are Bleu cheese and fresh mushrooms
We don't eat in restaurants anymore...just gave up...
Sometime I take a cooler with me with some basic foods to eat. So far most restaurants will let me bring it in. I also often bring my own bottled water.
I always take bottled water with me whenever I Ieave my house. Dressings on the salad? Was it washed properly? If it’s a store bought salad they use a mild bleach wash on the products.
Dressing is a bad one.  Anything with vinegar seems to have sulfites.
I don’t eat out - I take my own when I can...

message: So, I got a made to order takeout salad last night for dinner.  After eating it, my heart began to race.  Pretty sure sulfites were the culprit.  Is the only solution to living with a sulfite allergy NOT to eat out anymore?  What do you do if you attend a dinner or go to friend's house?  I have to stop running into sulfites.  I think my allergy is getting worse.

data.message: Essie Cunningham, was she having seizures?

She was sort of zoning out - looking like she wasn’t there. We would ask if she was feeling bad and she would say "I’m just tired" and then within a minute or two would projectile vomit across the room with no warning. All tests came back negative for seizures.
I have seizures with bad reactions. They also tested me repeatedly for epilepsy even after I knew it was sulfites.
My daughter was tested for epilepsy and other neurological disorders  and diagnosed with migraines before we discovered she has issues with sulfites.
Same for me except arthritis. Add ADHD, which was folate deficiency more than anything
And tested extensively for Lupus
Same
Candice Withrow what do you do for the adhd then? Are foliate supplements available?
Tracy Stopa Moran I take follinic acid (NOT folic) and a small amount of methylfolate ..I don't tolerate methyls well

Candice Withrow that's fascinating. I forgot to include my ADD diagnosis as well. How did you learn about follinic acid? I'm wondering if this would help me or my partner. I still deal with ADD symptoms but it's not life altering. My partner, however, has severe ADHD. We recently discovered he is sulfite and sulfate intolerant as well.
Angelina Salwak wow! Life changing!
Candice Withrow I cant tolerate the Methylfolate at all. Maybe need to try follinic!

It's a form well tolerated by those with methyl issues, and folate is generally recommended for those with our issues. I also have iron deficient anemia, and when my ADHD was at it's worst, I was on hormonal IUD and also had premature gray hair. Iron helped, but when I finally was able to tolerate folate and then boosted follinic, my ability to focus really transformed. It is necessary precursor for dopamine/seretonin and melatonin as well. So for me, increasing made me able to sleep without taking melatonin, able to focus, and also means I don't feel suicidal after my period. It's a very very important vitamin, but remember the B's work together and if you only take one it can deplete you of others
https://www.seekinghealth.com/essentials/vitamins/b-vitamins/folate/folinic-acid
They also sell it with hydroxy B12, which is only form that works for me, but I take separately because I'm a control freak
Candice Withrow you COMT then?
Angelina Salwak check into MTHFR.
Juliane Benoit yes, hetero ..I haven't looked at genes in awhile though so don't quiz me haha
Candice Withrow I’m COMT +/+. I’m taking a little of this, like 1/2 the lozenge, but I don’t seem able to tolerate the folinic. Does that make sense?
Candice Withrow I’m COMT +/+ and take 1/2 of this right now. I don’t seem to be able to tolerate folinic tho. Does that make sense?

Hmm, I have't heard of having trouble with folinic, I know I had to add methylfolate very slowly and could never take much. I saw something recently that implied I should avoid it completely , but haven't been able to research.. How do you do with foods high in folinic?
Candice Withrow which would those be? Greens? Other?
Juliane Benoit here's one infographic
Angelina Salwak following
I was diagnosed with kinda everything. Fibromyalgia, arthritis, depression, anxiety, bipolar disorder, OCD, etc. Guess what all disappeared when I went sulfite free? Yeah.
Chronic persistent migraine. I still get migraines but only a few times a month opposed to every single day.
Carol Ricchio Nelson, sulfites increase bp?
It does for me big time.  First thing I notice is high pulse rate and then my BP will skyrocket!

I'm struggling at the moment, trying to determine whether I really need to do an expensive echo and heart monitor(thousands of dollars out of pocket) to determine if my rapid heartbeat, which I think is due primarily to sulfites, is due to something more.  I do have a family history of heart valve issues.

I have echos and wore a 24 hr monitor for them to find no issues.  But everyone is different.  If nothing else having those tests will give you peace of mind if they find nothing and solidify your suspicion of sulfites.
Normally, I would do it...absolutely.  But it's going to cost me $5000+.  Ugh.
Does your heart doctor know about your sulfite issue and does he or she understand what can happen if you have a sulfite episode?
Been to the emergency room several times.  Blaming it on high  BP not realizing the high blood pressure was caused by sulfites.  Also blaming it on my thyroid numbers.  Always sulfite related!

Linnea Fraser Wieland  I think the rarest reaction I have seen is my daughter, artificial  Manmade sulfites for her cause hysterical crying, halucinations, paranoia and night terrors. You may seem mood improvements
That’s awful. I hope she has it under control, I can’t imagine living like that.
Wow! Your stories are fascinating. I’m so eager to see what gets better when no sulfites are ingested.

I was tested for epilepsy, and when it showed up normal I was told I had anxiety -_- and they wanted me to get on antidepressants. they also almost diagnosed me with chronic fatigue syndrome. Basically they couldn't figure out what was wrong with me so it must all be in my head. It was a very difficult first year or 2 with this issue.
Linnea Fraser Wieland I get tremors with a reaction, and used to get psychosomatic seizures when I was really sick and also on prozac (seemed to combine to cause problems)

Linnea Fraser Wieland in my case both my eegs came back completely normal. But I was having seizures every week at my worst and it was scary! I never lost consciousness with them but they were big. One time I convulsed off the bed from the center of it. And I had a bunch of other neurological issues like temporary aphasia and paralysis. My reactions have gotten substantially milder after changing my lifestyle.
Katie Richards so glad you've had relief.

Candice Withrow me too. I'll be 3 years seizure free on February 23rd. Almost had one a few weeks ago from Uncle Matts juice (they must have changed something because they used to be safe for me), but activated charcoal is a life saver.
Oh no! Which one? I do fine with Uncle Matt's generally, but mostly drink the grapefruit juice which , seems to have its own healing effects
Katie Richards, activated charcoal stops the sulfite reaction?
Katie Richards, how can you have a seizure without losing consciousness?

Candice Withrow the grapefruit and orange juice. at least that's what I believe was causing the issue because I had a huge glass of it the night of my reaction and then the next day I had a huge glass again to help my liver and immediately started getting twitchy. But it could have also been the blackberry spindrift. It just seems I reacted right after drinking the juice both days.

Linnea Fraser Wieland my seizures are the type with the unfortunate name of "psychosomatic" (even though they aren't -- it's what they call seizures that you stay conscious during). I get auras with them and sometimes migraines as precursor but for whatever reason the sulfite act like enough of a neurotoxin to trigger issues with movement and speech and the seizures but don't actually make me lose consciousness.
also, activated charcoal can really mitigate bad reactions. Just don't take it within 2 hours if your supplements or medications as it affects absorption.
Well, the grapefruit juice has still been working well for me. Maybe take a break from it and try small amount later on, or - do you react to other sugars?
Katie Richards, did not know about that.  You're lucky that you don't lose consciousness.

Why epilepsy?  I've been diagnosed with that - 30 years ago - for 2 grand mal seizures I had out of the blue - but I did have an abnormal EEG.  They had no explanation for them.  Just put me on Dilantin.  Wonder if sulfites could cause seizures and an abnormal EEG!
Would love to get off Dilantin!
Asthma and migraines
I was tested for epilepsy.
Asthma and bed bug bites......
Why did they think your reactions might be seizure activity? Was there an EEG done?

Linnea Fraser Wieland yes, an EEG was done showing activity that could have been conducive to seizures. Sulfites make me sneeze with a force that could be measured on the earthquake Rictor scale, (not like I usually sneeze) so we thought it was worth a try. I did have relief from reactions for a while, but who knows why. Now I can easily very correlate reactions with what I've eaten.

In my 20's (I'm 57 now) they thought my sulfite reactions might be brain seizure activity. I was on Dilantin (ugh!) a few years. I was also diagnosed with allergies though I didn't respond to any allergy tests. And when all that didn't work I was told it was a psychological problem, the catch all for unexplained illnesses. It's only in recent years since the Internet I've been able to figure it out and begin to improve in this area. I'm sooo grateful though I miss eating a lot of foods I used to enjoy.
Jim Williams how were the sulphites introduced to your system? Meds? Anesthesia?

Leslie Basil Payne Anesthesia and antibiotics given through an IV. At the time I didn’t know I had a sulphite problem. I was only having headaches. After surgery my heart would pound and race after eating. It took another year and a half to figure out what was causing it.
Jim Williams thank you!
My doctor thought it was anxiety. Before I was bombarded with sulphites during surgery I only had headaches and took allergy shots for 15 years. It was assumed that was causing my headaches.
Christine Schmidt my allergist thinks sulfites show up in wines or bacon, but nothing more. One day he'll understand.

I have to wait until my referral expires and find a new one. I was sent to a dermatologist to biopsy a bunch of hives, he believed me and gave me an epi pen. My gp believes but cant get forms filled out without official dx
Christine Schmidt my allergist said the same thing! 🤦🏼‍♀️
Get a new allergist ..ours diagnosed my son from eating dried fruit

Shannon Nardin  my referral  expires in May so will have to research others. The one I saw runs the only clinic in that area so others don't go against him. Will be confirming before I waste my time and money that they will consider sulphites
My allergist doesnt believe in sulphites as a possible allergen. He still has me diagnosed as chronic ideopathic urticaria. I found that i feel better and less reactions if i take sulphites out

My allergist is old school. Will not even consider that my health improved when I am more careful.     When I look back I have been having issues for decades with sulphite. Once I reduced my exposure internal and external a lot changed for me. My BP went down, pressure headaches were fewer, skin reactions decreased, heart palpations were fewer as well. I had skin issues in high school 35 years ago that have stopped as long as I stay low to no exposure.

Linnea Fraser Wieland they're a documented allergen but I don't think it's fully understood where they hide. For example Corn harvested to be used in corn products (like corn flour, syrup or meal) is harvested and then soaked in vats of sulphites before processing. So if a friend made some homemade candy and said there were no sulphites in it, but was made with corn syrup I wouldn't eat it.

They're one of the listed allergens in food in Europe but nobody wants to test for them or really knows what they are/what contains them. Definitely don't believe they're in anything non food related, or where they aren't listed as an ingredient.
Leslie Basil Payne, gotcha. Didn’t know that.
Linnea Fraser Wieland we're all ever learning about this, aren't we?😊
Sulfites are a pretty well documented allergen.

I got diagnosed as having cough variant asthma. (The next specialists said there was no such thing). Put on various preventers and also Nebuliser meds. I do have really mild asthma (I never wheeze out loud), but I have a chronic cough. I don’t think it’s related to asthma at all. I’m going to see my 4th Lung specialist (due to my GP,s insistence).
Following
Linnea Fraser Wieland as far as I know, food allergies can't be treated this way. Like lactose, gluten, sulfur, etc. It's your body's inability to process, so not an allergy like pollen.
Angelina Salwak, are we missing an enzyme that processes sulfites?
Angelina Salwak, so like lactose, is there a pill we can take like Lactase that will help?

Linnea Fraser Wieland yes, kind of. Lactase I feel is often misused and mis-adervertised. Many brands claim it will allow you to eat lactose again but really it just helps your body process it, but won't prevent it from doing damage to your system.

Many of us take molybdenum to help process sulfites that we naturally come into contact with. It can help lessen the severity of a reaction as well. But it won't allow you to be able to eat the standard American diet without doing some serious damage to your digestive system unfortunately.
This is a sulfite free brand of molybdenum.

For any supplements, do research into bioavailability. Many supplements on the market contain vitamins in forms that aren't actually able to be processed or absorbed by the body or contain additives like gelatin, starch or natural flavors. Chelated forms are often more easily absorbed. NOW and Solgar brands are often made bioavailable and sulfite free!
Why can’t a sulfite allergy be treated with allergy shots?
Shannon Nardin I had a horrible reaction to Bactrim last year.
My son has sulfite allergy ..only one who believed was allergist until they prescribed a sulfa drug ( bactrim) and he had allergic reaction

This is interesting.  I take B12 for a B12 deficiency.  Why does a sulfite intolerance cause a B12 deficiency?
Linnea Fraser Wieland interesting they are testing my son's b12 and b2 again because he has side cracked lips but he's also cortisol deficient so might be related

Linnea Fraser Wieland cbs gene issues drags down a number of nutrients incl b12. CBS gene issues are the typical cause of sulphite intolerance. There are several causes of b12 deficiency - it was sulphites for me.
Depression diagnosis cured by b12 injections  which is directly related to b12 deficiency caused by sulphite intolerance.
Mast Cell activation syndrome. Went down that rabbit hole for quite a while.

data.message: I'd say black pepper xxx
Yeah it was organic - from Davids tea in Canada... which is why I had hoped it was safe. So frustrating :(

Kristen David’s Teas has a lot of ingredients which get citric acid & sulphites added to them. In the past I’ve had trouble with cross contamination of nuts (different allergy) in some of their teas, so I would suspect that there’s likely cross contamination with sulphites, or that one or more of the herbs/spices was processed with sulphites.

In Canada, if the end result has more than 10 PPM they have to label sulphites present, but if it’s under that threshold they don’t have to label it; particularly if sulphites were used in the processing of the item. 

Generally speaking if you’re reacting under 10ppm... you may want to consider calling the company and checking a) if they use sulphites at any point in their process and b) if there are sulphites used by their suppliers in the ingredients. It usually takes a couple days for companies to get back to you, but the effort is worthwhile because then the next time someone calls, they’ll have the information... or at least be more aware that sulphite allergies & sensitivities exist!
Thank you! This is helpful info
It may have to do with the processing. Was it organic? (Doesn't always mean it's safe, but there's a better chance)

Black pepper is fermented

Licorice root can affect your electrolytes
Bernice that may not be sulphite related; Ginger is one of my safe foods?

Ginger is good. Trick is that we need only fresh ginger.

I think you reacted on mint.

Ginger is good. Trick is that we need only fresh ginger.

I have issues with loose leaf tea but not tea bags. I think it has something to do with processing or storing. They might dust the loose tea with something to prevent clumping & prolong shelf life. If it’s a small enough amount it doesn’t have to be listed on the label.
I would suspect salicylates. How do you respond to aspirin?
Fennel!  Allium Cousin. If you eat fresh fennel on its own... baby bites and have a reaction, then you know.
pepper contain sulphur compound -thiol

I’m guessing here....with sulphites it’s all to do with preserving. So, black tea is a no no because they spray it to preserve it. I’m wondering if the things in your tea has been sprayed to preserve them as they were dried. Organic refers only to how it’s grown.

Powdered ginger is a no for me. I’m scared of all herbal teas. There are ca couple kinds of black and green I get by with if I don’t drink too much or too often. And bleached tea bags are culprits also

Peas like all legumes are high in Mo. But peas are also high in sulfur and no for those with G6PDD so for sure this is not a solution for all. 
There is the list of the sulfite oxidase enzyme boosting nutrients in the files.
Most people will need to boost other enzymes as well and work on various metabolic pathways as well.

Abigail Bromell all legumes are high in molybdenum. But due to the difficult digestion most legumes are not well tolerated with people who have gut issues. Non organic legumes are sprayed with glyphosate so only organic if you are not having issues with high sulfur foods and don’t have G6PDD.

Linnea Fraser Wieland I think I got the info from EPA. acid rain is sulfuric acid. When it's humid and I'm around auto exhaust, my brain fog gets worse. I also researched sulfur dioxide poisoning which is basically what happens to us when exposed, so the info might have come from OCEA. Emergency treatment is bicarbonate of soda, aka baking soda. In a hospital emergency treatment facility, intravenous bicarbonate of soda is used.

So I use a tbsp of baking soda in water followed with extra water when I'm feeling sulfites symptoms. It helps my gut. My digestive system gets non-functional when I'm exposed to sulfites I think from swelling from sulfuric acid. Fresh celery helps too. Hope you feel better soon!

Also I think social media causes brain fog for anyone. :) I'm limiting my exposure to it in hopes it relieves at my current brain fog. Just has a little baking soda water too. Mine has been so severe that I got in financial trouble from not being able to take care of important business. It's a serious problem!
Sulfites turn into sulfuric acid when they mix with water if not converted into sulfates. Sulfuric acid destroys dopamine which would explain brain fog.
Yep. My daughter has celiacs and gluten causes brain fog for her too. I think it's part of any reaction to something the body doesn't want

Linnea Fraser Wieland My doctor put me on anxiety pills but I knew it was food because it would start right after I eat.

I’m pretty sure it made my heart murmur worse. It took me 19 months to figure out my problem after I was given antibiotics in an IV. So for 18 months my heart pounded and I had anxiety attacks. Now I can hear my heart murmur when my ear is against a pillow.

Towards the end of 2018, I was diagnosed with a heart murmur by the immunologist, which I think has occurred due to my sulfite allergies.  Earlier that year, I was getting really sick so kept a food diary.  I found that prawns and seafood are preserved with Sodium Metabisulfite (E223).  I reacted to a Dominos pizza so I checked with the company.  They said the pizza base had flour treatment agents (516, 300, 920).  I found 516 is Calcium Sulphate.
Interesting.  I eat Dominos occasionally but don't usually react.
yes , meeeee early morning palpitations if i consumed sulphite at night
I think it has something to do with the body going into fight or flight mode when you put something in it that it sees as an invader. It releases histamine and adrenaline to help you survive.
So it's histamine and adrenaline that cause the palpitations?
Linnea Fraser Wieland I believe so. I’m not sure of all the science behind it. I have also had palps from seasonal allergies and even if I walk into a room full of kittens.
Interesting.
I'm fascinated by this sulfite/palpitation connection.
Carol Miller, that’s fascinating.  My bp has been high. 140-150. Never thought the sulfites could be causing that.  What is the range you refer to for sulfites?

Linnea Fraser Wieland
220	Sulphur dioxide
221	Sodium sulfite
222	Sodium bisulfite
223	Sodium metabisulfite
224	Potassium metabisulfite
226	Calcium sulphite
227	Calcium bisulfite
228	Potassium bisulfite
Carol Miller, thanks. How do you know which range the sulfite you ingested is in?
I assume the higher the number the stronger the sulfite?
Linnea Fraser Wieland I have heard that the higher the number, the worse the additive is.

My heart rate increases if I accidentally ingest sulfites being in the E220-228 range.  My diastolic also raises 10 points - normally my blood pressure is 120/80.  When I am reacting, it raises to 120/90.
How do you know this?  Just trial and error.  Or did an allergist provide the info?
Linnea Fraser Wieland I have symptoms when I ingest any of these preservatives so anywhere I see them on ingredient lists, I don't purchase the product.

I need to avoid these preservatives:
   Sorbates                    	200-203
   Benzoates                  	210-219
   Sulphites                  	220-228
   Nitrates, nitrites          	249-252
   Propionates               	280-283

message: Anyone wind up with heart problems due to the palpitations caused by sulfites?

data.message: Clare Ross same
Not ocular but yes migraines are my primary reaction to sulphites. Best wishes

I  have  ocular  migraines  occasionally,  but  never  thought  to  link  them  to  sulfites.  I  do  remember  once  when  it  happened  i I was  getting  over  a  cold.  I  do  get  headaches  that  can  progress  to  migraines  from  certain  sulfites.
My ocular migraines decreased significantly after cutting out sulfites, and migraines are a sure thing if I happen to eat them. I have meds and migraine contacts to cope

My daughter’s primary reaction to sulfites is migraines but not ocular. I have a far less reaction to sulfites than she does but I do occasionally have ocular migraines. I have not been able to find any specific cause for the ocular migraines.
I used to get ocular migraines but haven’t had one for quite a while. I wonder if there was a sulfite connection?

I suffered with ocular migraines until I was 50 and figured out what was triggering them . Only 2 since and both times the restaurant got it wrong . I am on Zyrtec 10 mg once a day . I get horrible sinus pressure when I don’t watch my sulfite intake or forget to take the Zyrtec.  Much better quality of life for sure now !!
I have had ocular migraines. They are so scary. The first time it happened, I thought I was having a stroke. For me, I don’t think it was sulfite related.
It has been a while but I get them.  Usually happened when I was extra stressed.
I get them when reacting.
Brenda Anderson O'Halloran I get flashing zig zag lines too that last 5-10 minutes...I get a dull headache and siz .
Cat Cuzzi sounds like an ocular migraine to me

I get them couple times a year and have discovered no triggers except possibly bright sunlight. Never thought about them being from a sulfite reaction. I’ll pay attention next time.  Mine aren’t flashing lights, they are little zigzags lights that increas in size as they move from the top of mynfield of vision and drop down til they are gone in about 20 minutes.
I get them too!

I had my first one for a couple of years this week. For me I don’t think mine are connected to sulphites, but definitely low blood sugar and stress, not just either one, but all in combination, it’s as if my body goes in to overload when too much is going on. I hope you feel better soon.
I get them too.  I have tried to identify the triggers but it gets complicated. Amitriptyline  helps in low doses and muscle relaxers also in low doses. Not painful but can't see very well.
My son has been complaining of "light flashes" for years. Just this week his neurologist mentioned it may be ocular migraines and we are going to start him on amitriptyline to see if it helps.

My triggers are sulfites . The ocular migraines are my first sign of the sulfite reaction, then on to the full on severe headache and severe vomiting that lasts up to 6-8 hours .  Then I am “hung over “ for about 3-4 hours followed by completely fine .

I had them in relation to salicylates I think. Last time was the absolute worst and it was a reaction to Pepto Bismol. I know because I stupidly took a little again later and my headache came back immediately. That time I had swirling, flashing, bright colors, horrible headache and felt nauseated. The visual stuff freaks me out every time! I haven't had it at all since I figured out my diet.
Yes and yes. Diesel exhaust is the worst culprit.
Mine seem to be triggered by low blood sugar and/or bright lights, but only in conjunction with fluctuating hormones. I haven’t thought about a sulfite connection but will look for it, too.
Stella Papanicolaou I’m right there with you. Sulfites, salicylates, etc. I don’t know where to start.
I get ocular migraines, itchy skin, burning tongue, swollen lips, bloating, tests have identified sulfite sensitivity and msg, struggling to figure out what to eat

Just has my second ocular migraine this week. Both times I had been exposed to strong smells, was stressed out over something and hadn't had enough to drink. I react to smells and had a headache for a week before it happened. When having this last one I had a lot of pressure on the side of my face next to my eye. Oh and by the way get your eyes checked if you have new floaters, blurred vision or any other strange vision problems. My husband has had a bunch of tears that were repaired and didn't keep up with his recheck appointments, he ended up with a detached retina. He's only 58. Now he had to lay on his stomach all but 6 hours a day and pray it heals well.

message: Do any of you get ocular migraines? Any relationship to sulfites? Or detoxing? Or low blood sugar? I have had two today, which is unusual I just get the flashing lights on the periphery of my vision and they last about 45 minutes. No headaches.Thanks for any help.

data.message: Mike Balasa funny you should say so . I’ve recently been diagnosed with mold / biotoxin illness after blood work , which is causing my Lyme disease & bartonella to not heal, low immune function etc  . We’re getting the house tested & assesed hopefully soon . Don’t know if it’s a factor in my breathing but the cold weather is when I really suffer , especially outside or in the car .
Change your filter in a car as well, takes seconds
Get some salbutamol as well if you getting problems with breathing

Mike Balasa yes I do even twice last year I did because the pollen I felt was giving me allergic attacks with ac on, but don’t think it made a difference . Spring - fall is terrible for me in the car .
Do you tried Montelukast tablets? It’s works really well.
Mike Balasa yep been on for a while now . Just the winter kills me
Try do not dry your washing inside, get dehumidifier
Mike Balasa ya I was told to get a dehumidifier if the hygrometer reads over 50 but it hasn’t .... don’t dry clothes in dryer you mean ? Why ?
Make shure you air your rooms and spray bleach on any signs of black mould in bathroom and anywhere else in your house. Avoid humid environment.
I do the duo neb and have no issues.  My doc said it’s ions and shouldn’t bother me.... it doesn’t and recently tried albuterol by itself in my nebulizer....again no issues.

message: Anyone know of any safe nebulizer treatments that doesn’t contain sulfuric acid ? This winter is making my breathing harsh and my dr would like me to try it / thanks

data.message: Thank you! I am normally OK with those things. I was wondering if there is cross contamination from maybe being baked next to or on the same surface as the sun-dried tomato ones? Or maybe it was that the person had handled those or vinaigrette prior to my order.
I looked up the ingredients and personally I would react to a lot of these things. Enriched flour, malted ingredients and folic acid.
I’m ok with them

message: Has anyone had problems with Bruegger's plain bagels?  I had some kind of reaction today.  I thought they were sulfite free, but maybe it was cross-contamination?

data.message: yes
Yes
Yes!
Thank you, Leanne. I did histamine test and it was negative, so I have to exclude that.

Look into histamine intolerance.  Most of what you listed is high histamine, regardless of sulfites.

http://healthypixels.com/?p=1044
Yes
Same here- I feel better since avoiding trigger foods, however, some days I still struggle. Thank you for your reply.

I reckon it's both HIT and preservatives .... whether the test showed it or not. According to all the tests for everything I am I great health.... if only that were true. It's like walking through treacle every day to balance my eating and some days I win and other days I lose but don't always know why!
Yes, and the sulfites are not only in the foods and drinks but also in personal care products, cleaning products and environmental.
Yes, also swelling.
Thank you Gareth. I was aware of E220 to E228, but not E150.
Would recommend avoiding sulphur related E numbers E150 and E220 to E228 😁😁
Yes, I had some dental work done. Why would it matter?
Dental work?

message: Hello everyone. For years I would experience symptoms which usually appeared shortly after eating. I did allergy and intolerance tests and excluded problematic foods- gluten, dairy and eggs. However, my symptoms persevered. And that when I noticed reaction after eating fried potatoes, drinking fizzy drinks, mayo, lemon juice, gluten free bolognese cooked with red wine and some gluten free products with sulphur dioxide.  My symptoms are heart palpitations, brain fog, nervousness, paranoid thinking, upset tummy, flushed face, dry mouth. Could other relate to that?
